S.FORM: yako kaysa’an hinSayboSi: o ’aehae’ potngor ray kakiSka:atan.
S.TRANSL: 我今天七點到學校。
I arrived at school at seven today.

S.FORM: kiSka:at ila kamatortoroe’ kaS’abo’ ray kakiSka:atan kamatilhael Sa’ “’in’itol! te’en!”
S.TRANSL: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: niya’om pinayaka:i’ sobae:oh Sa’ “kamatortoroe’ kayzaeh!”
S.TRANSL: 我們大聲的說:「老師好！」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: ray ’am kiSka:at, kamatortoroe’ tomotoroe’ ’iniya’om nom Sempe: kapayaka:i’.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the SaySiyat language of numbers.

S.FORM: yami tani kamatortoroe’ kiSka:at, yami ma:tol ila nom Sempe: kapa:tol.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: yako tatoroe’ ’akoy ka kinra:aman kapayaka:i’.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many SaySiyat languages.

S.FORM: ya:o sa’sa’ih ka hahila: rima’ kiSka:at, ya:o sa’sa’ih ka hahila: tatoroe’ ka kapayaka:i’ ya:o ’am manabih pakbaezae’ hi ’oya’.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the SaySiyat language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: ma’an raro:o’ hi ’ataw.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是’ataw。
My name is ’ataw.

S.FORM: ni yaba’ ma’an raro:o’ hi kalih.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是kalih。
My dad’s name is kalih.

S.FORM: ni ’oya’ ma’an raro:o’ hi maya’.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是maya’。
My mother’s name is maya’.

S.FORM: ya:o ’isahini lampez tinal’oemaeh.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: ya:o hayza’ ’aehae’ minatini’ kamamanra:an siya Sin ta:inin, siya ’isahini lampez o ’aehae’ tinal’oemaeh.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫ta:in，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is ta:in, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: yami ray ’ima hingha’ kakiSka:atan kiSka:at.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: yako ki minatini’ kamamannra:an minowa’ ma:tol.
S.TRANSL: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: ya:o minowa’ lalangoy, ray minaSangay, yami ’aehae’ taew’an ma’onhael rima’ lalangoy.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: ya:o minowa’ Sekla’ ka ’ima SaSo’ kapa’onhaelan yami kayzaeh ma’onhael ma:tol ki lalangoy.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: ya:o ’in noka SaySiyat a korkoring.
S.TRANSL: 我是賽夏族的小孩。
I am an SaySiyat child.

S.FORM: niya’om taew’an ray walo’.
S.TRANSL: 我們家住在東河。
Our family lives in Donghe.

S.FORM: niya’om taew’an hayza’ haseb mae’iyaeh.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: niya’om taew’an hayza’ to:o’ ’aehael.
S.TRANSL: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: ya:o ki yaba’, ’oya’ minatini’ kamamanra:an ki minatini’ minkoringan ma’onhael rowaSek.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: ma’an yaba’ ’ibabaw, yaba’ ma’an kinSat.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: ma’an ’oya’ bali’, ’oya’ ma’an sinsang.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: yaba’ ray taew’an ki yami malnoSaySiyat.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家和我們說族語。
My father speaks the ethnic language with us at home.

S.FORM: yami ray haba:an ’ima ’inaro’ kaSangayan hahila: lobih ray ’asang.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: yako kila minatini ma’onhael rima’ romakep ka takem.
S.TRANSL: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: yako minowa’ yami ’aehae’ taew’an mae’iyaeh.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我們家的人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: kaysa’an ya:o ki ’oya’ ’am rima’ manmanra:an.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: ’ima Sera: kawaS kinhis’alan, kawaS ’okik kaskes ma’ ’okik rikrika:, ba:i’ kin’iya’zaw.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: yami ray hinhinbetelan maSa:eng somi’ael ka pang, basang hila:en noka hahila:, koza’ kinha:olhoel.
S.TRANSL: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: hila:an kawaS ’iniyangangilaeh ila.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: ya:o somingozaw hi ’oya’, ’ampowa’ kawaS ngangilaehan.
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的。
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: ’oya’ manabih, nakhara bayoS ’am mowa:i’ ila.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: hae:wan ray kawaS ’oka’ ka homom, bintoe’an kas’oehaez ila.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: yami ma’ ’am lobih ila.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: ray karara:an, ya:o paho’alo’ ka bintoe’an.
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願。
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: pakSiwa’ bayoS ’izi’ wa:i’, ya:o ’iyakinakaSlatar manmanra:an.
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: ma’an kakiSka:atan ray ’in niya’om a taew’an langi:, ya:o sa’sa’ih ka hahila: manra:an rima’ ray kakiSka:atan, ma’ manra:an lobih ray taew’an.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: niya’om kakiSka:atan ’okik sobae:oeh, ’okik ’akoey ka kamakiSka:at, SaSekla’ hahi:il.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: Saeboeh korkoring raroton ray kap‘ae’ae:iwan, ma’onhael makakSiyae’ ki ’a’iyalatar.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: lakamatortoroe’ ma’ mae’onhael ki yami makakSiyae’, kakiSka:atan nak ’aehae’ taew’an.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: sa’sa’ih ka hahila: somaepoh, ’ita’ ’am ’okay pakhara:i’ katatoroe’an.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: hayza’ mae’iyaeh tomi:iS ka hinohaez, hayza’ mae’iyaeh somaepoh ka rape:.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: yami ma’ ra:am somaepoeh ray kakiSka:atan kalihokan, ’ita’ ’a’apel kapatawawen, kakiSka:atan sa’sa’ih ka hahila: ma’ ’am ’okik hara:i’.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: kahiya’, yako rima’ ray ’asang payrarongaw hi baki’.
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: yami honaehnge: ila ’okik kakita’, yako maSriyae’ hi siya.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: baki’ komita’ ’iyakin, pasi’ael ka ba:ay o parae’oe: ka kashaw ’iyakin.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

S.FORM: ni baki’ pinamowa’ ka ba:ay ’anhil, sa’owaz kayzaeh a tomal si’aelen.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: yako ma’ minowa’ ni baki’ ka kashaw, kayzaeh rae’oe:on.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。
I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.

S.FORM: ray ’ima hila:an, yako ki koko’ ma’onhael tikinsi’ael.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: ni koko tinalek ’akoey a ta:an, hayza’ ka ’aelaw, hayza’ ka tata:a’, hayza’ ka lilom, hayza’ ka mona:.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

S.FORM: komsi’ael sizaeh, yami rima’ ray tatimae’an titatimae’.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: koko’ mari’ ’akoey ka ’aewpir, rokol ki ’oe’ong, Sipa’alibih ’iyakin ray taew’an.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: yako ki lasiya papil’awan ila, So: honasamez ila ’am mowa:i’ naehan komita’ hi lasiya.
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道別，說下次有空再去看他們。
I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.

S.FORM: kaysa’an kamatortoroe’ maraS ’iniya’om, rima’ ray kita’an ka Sinpanan yami ray kakaS’abo’an ’aehae’ ’aehae’ wawa:ih bae:iw nom kaS’abo’ ka pinaSkira:a’.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: kaS’abo’ ray kakita’an ka Sinpanan, kamatortoroe’ manabih Sa’, “ray kati’aela’ ka kita’an ka kabkabaeha:, hikor kakita’an ka Siba:i’, ’ita’ ’iSkanonak kita’ ila”.
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: yako tikot ka Siba:i’, isa:a kayni’ komita’ ka Siba:i’.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: yako komita’ ’akoy ka kabkabaeha:, lasiya ray kaehoy babaw homayhayap, hayza’ naehan Saehoro: ka kal’oe’ ray kaehoy horo’ ’izo’ minae’rem.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: ray kakita’an ka Sinpanan hayza’ ka ba:ong, hanowan ki heklaw, ma’an kakhayza’an ‘inokay Saehoro: i’ hini Sipanan, kaysa’an kita’en ila hahi:il kinSiyae’ a tomal.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: ma’an ’inalingo’, ’akoy, kapakita’ hi ’oya’ ki yaba’.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: mayhal ’am ki yaba’ ’oya’ ma’onhael ’am mowa:i’ naehan rini.
S.TRANSL: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: ray hini minaSangay hahila: yako ki minatini’ minkoringan rima’ taytong payrarongaw hi mama’.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: yami ’in’alay taypae’ papama’ ka kalihaepoyan rima’ taytong.
S.TRANSL: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

S.FORM: potngor ray taytong, mama’ seme:ez kapapama’an mowa:i’ ray ka’ayna:an kapapama’an sasbong ’iniya’om.
S.TRANSL: 到了台東，叔叔開車來車站接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: ka’ayna:an kapapama’an ’al’alihan kala mama’ ray taew’an, papama’ honha:i’ ma’ potngor.
S.TRANSL: 車站離叔叔家沒有很，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.

S.FORM: ni mama’ taew’an langi: hayza’ ’aehae’ ’ima mowahil kaSpanan ka Sinpanan, yami’ papama’ ka ritinSiya’ rima’ ray kaSpanan ka Sinpanan.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。
There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: ray kaSpanan ka Sinpanan, yami tomabo: ka Siri’ papama’ ka hanowan.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: roehaenan, yami mae’onhael rima’ ray titiyaman komSa:o’.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: rima’ ray titiyaman ’asang ’akoy ka kapapama’an, ’isa:a yami papama’ ka ’otobay rima’ risaza.
S.TRANSL: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: ’am lobih ila, kita’en ’otobay Sikarma’ ila, ’isa:a yami’ papama’ ka baSe’ lobih.
S.TRANSL: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: ’isa:a hini yami lobih ila ray taypae’, ’okik ra:am ni mama’ ’otobay tihoro:on ila ay.
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: ray ’ima ’ol’olae’an niya’om taew’an ray walo’, kiSka:at ila, ba:aw ila ray to’ing, ’isa:a ray raehoran ila nanaw rowa:Sek.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在東河，上學以後，就搬到了桃園，一直在都市裡生活。
When we were young, our family lived in Donghe. After I started school, we moved to Taoyuan and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: kiSka:at ila ray kam’ibabaw kakiSka:atan, yako pawhi:il ila ’aehae’ kakiSka:aten noka SinSinraeho’ kaspengan. Sekla’ ila ray taywan SinSinraeho’ hayza’ ’akoy ka ’ima ’okik hingha’ ka kaspengan.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: ’isa:a, ’isahini tinal’omaeh ray ’ima ’inaro’ ka kaSangayan, yako ki minatini’ kamamanra:an lobih ray ’asang somingozaw ka tatini’, ’am Sekla’ ka ’in nonak a kaspengan.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: tatini’ monmaykaSpat ila tinal’omaeh, ma’ kita’en nak ‘al’alak naehan.
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: ya:o somingzaw hi siya ra:am piza’ kapayaka:i’, siya malnoSySiyat ra:am a tomal, ma’ ra:am ’oyaeh malnoSaypapa:aS, malnomoto: ki malnoripon.
S.TRANSL: 我問他會哪些語言，他的賽夏語說得很流利，也會說泰雅語、客家話和日本話。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Saisiyat, as well as Atayal, Hakka and Japanese.

S.FORM: yako somingozaw hi siya ’isa:a ra:am ila, siya ’ima ’ol’olae’an kiSka:at ka ’alnoripon, minkoringan nisiya Saypapa:aS, siya ray kapatawawan Sekla’ ’akoy ka moto:, ’isa:a siya ra:am ’akoy ka kapayaka:i’.
S.TRANSL: 我問他才知道，他小時候就學日本話，太太是泰雅族人，而他工作上認識許多客家人，所以他會說這麼多語言。
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Atayal, and he knows many Hakkas at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: yami ’ima somingozaw, tatini’ manabih ’akoy nisiya kinra:aman nom ’omalep ka howaw.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: ’ana yami haSa’ baezae’, niya’om noka laleke: ’alingo’on, ’isa:a kayzaeh hayza’ naehan kabaezae’en.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: ’ima ’ol’olae’an ’okik Sekla’ ka ’in nonak a kaspengan, komita’ nonak ma’ SaySiyat kaSikar a tomal.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: Sekla’ kin’akoy, nonak Sapang SaySiyat, sa’owaz maynonak a tomal, ma’ kayzaeh patopa: ma’an Sapang ka Sinrahoe’.
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為賽夏族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Saisiyat is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: ’isa’an rohaenan, minayti’ kamanra:an ’am lobih ray taew’an.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: yako ki koko rima’ ray ka titibae:iwan ka tatima’ bae:iw ka tata:a’.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: yami maray ka titibae:iwan ka tatimae’, tinitibae:iw ’akoy baba:aw minari’ ka por’oe’.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: yami bae:iw ka por’oe’, Sako: ki sitaew.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了青菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

S.FORM: ray langi: kamatitibae:iw ka boway tahoki’ Sa’, “ma’an panrang ki ’a:immapizos ’anhih, o bae:iw sowiti’ ay!”
S.TRANSL: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: yami bae:iw ila ka panrang ki ’a:imapizos.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: yami maray kamatitibae:iw ka ’ayam, tahoki’ Sa’, “So’o ’am bae:iw ka kano? kaysa’an tata:a’ sopaloy o kerpe:, ’aehae’ to:o’ kaeboehoel rayhil.”
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: koko komoSa’ wa’isan tomal, somingozaw hi tahoki’ kayzaeh ay waelae’ sowiti’ ka rayhil.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: tahoki’ Sa’ hororay a tomal, ’amkay waelae’ ila.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: ray kabih tahoki’ Sa’, wa’ila bae:iw ma’an ka ’aelaw, ma’an ’aelaw rarahoe’ o hororay.
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: bi:il ila yami bae:iw ila ka tata:a’ ma’ bae:iw ka ’aelaw ’alibihin ray taew’an taleken, tinalek ’aehae’ talka: ka tatimae’.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: minayna:a’ kinhonaehnge:, kawaS ma’ ’iyasiwi’ ila.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: minayti’ kamamanra:an pawa:i’ ka laleke: manabih Sa’, hitay hayza’ ka howaw kayni SiSangay, ’am ’aehae’ naehan ka Sinangayan ray kaSangayan hahila: ’am lobih ila.
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: koko Sa’ tinalek kin’akoy, kobae:oeh ka saeboeh wa’ila si’ael!
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!

S.FORM: yami pawa:i’ ka ’aeh’aehael, ma’onhael mowa:i’ komSa:o’ ka ’ima kayzaeh kasi’aelen.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: ya:o hayza’ ’aehae’ kapa’ohhaelan Sin kalihin, siya rengreng mangowip maraS ka kakrang’an.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學叫kalih，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named kalih, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: ’am kiSka:at ila, siya Somibae:aeh kala kapa’onhan ka kaka:at, tati:iS ’oka’ ma’ kaka:atan ka kina:at.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: monhael, monpoSal, monto:o’ saeboeh ma’ paSibae:aeh hi siya.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: ’ana nakhini, siya hayza’ ’ima ’awhay ka pinatawaw, rengreng Somibae:aeh ’okay pinobih ka kakrangi’an.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: bi:il ila saeboeh mae’iyaeh ma’ kayni’ ila paSibae:aeh hi siya ka kakrangi’an.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: hayza’ ’aehae’ hahila:, yami saeboeh rima’ manmanra:an.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: ray ra:an, kalih ’iniya ’inoSa’ ray kata’owan, siya ’okay ’araS nom tomi:iS ka zinowas.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，kalih想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, kalihwanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: siya Somina’ ka kapa’onhaelan, saeboeh ma’ tiSkobae:oeh Sa’, ya:o ma’ ’okay ’araS o.
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

S.FORM: kalih ’isa:a homangih ila, siya bi’i: komoSa’ ’ampowa’ moyo saeboeh kayni’ paSibae:aeh ’iyakin nom tomi:iS ka zinowas!
S.TRANSL: kalih急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!
kalih burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: kapa’onhaelan nisiya’ mayaka:i’ hi siya, ma’ So’o nonak ’okay ’araS o, So: paSibaehen ka kakrangi’an So’o ma’ haSa’ minobih!
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: mowa:i’ ’aehae’ hahila: kiSka:at, kalih minremreme’ potngor ila ray kakiSka:atan, kalih mari’ ka Sinibae:aehan ka kakrangi’an Sipinobih saeboeh ka kapa’onhaelan.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，kilih很早就到學校了，kalih把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, kalih arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: kalih tiSkobih ila ka kapa’onhaelan, mayaka:i’ Sa’ mowa:i’ naehan siya nonak ’am maraS ila ka kakrangi’an, ma’ ma’alo’ kapa’onhaelan Somiwa’ paSibae:aeh hi siya ka kakrang’an.
S.TRANSL: kalih向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。
kalih apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: yaba’ ma’an ray ’asang kama’alep.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: yako ray ’ima ’ol’olae’an, yaba’ ki mama’ ray ’ima rohaenan rima’ ’omalep, maraS ka sibal ki wawatos.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: ’ima Sera: ila, lasiya’ malibih ka ’inalep kakrangi’an lobih ray taew’an.
S.TRANSL: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: mak’aehae’ ma’ waliSan, mak’aehae’ ma’ hapis, ’oka’ ma’ kaehka:.
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: nasiya ’inalep ’alibihin minSa’la’ ray ’asang ’a’apelen, SipakSibe:ay ka ’aeh’aehael.
S.TRANSL: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: yako rengreng ’omaybel hi yaba’, ’am taniSowaw hi yaba’ rima’ ’omalep.
S.TRANSL: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: yaba’ Sa’ So: ya:o ’ibabaw ila, siya ’am maraS ila ’iyakin.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: ray ’asang kamanra:an noka baseng romakep ka kakrangi’an, lasiya ma’ ra:am Sitalnga’ ki linanger maSkan ka binaseng.
S.TRANSL: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

S.FORM: ma’an yaba’ ra:am pakkayzaeh ka talnga’, yaba’ mayaka:i’ Sa’, hini nom romakep ka kaehka:, ’ita’ pakkayzaeh kita’ noka ka’alepen ka Sinarakan, baseng ’aSkan ray kapayziza’an nasiya’.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

S.FORM: ’am ’omam’amoeh ma’onhael kil tatini’ rima’ ’omalep, yako sa’sa’ih ka hahila: lomoehloehay paskayzaeh nom baseng, kin’alikaeh ma’an ’inaSkan ka baseng, pateleng ila ka ’inalep.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: yaba’ komita’ manabih ’iyakin, mayhael So’o ’am ’ima wa’isan kama’alep.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: ’isahini yako ’ibabaw ila, ya:o pama’ ka boehoe: ki siwa:, tani hi yaba’ rima’ ’omalep.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: lobih ray ’asang ’inalep Si’a’apel ka ’aeh’aehael.
S.TRANSL: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: yaba’ Sa’, ma’alo’ a tomal noka tatini’ ka hino’alo’, mobe:ay ’ini mita’ kin’akoey ka ’inalep.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: yako karim’aenan rima’ ray kakiSka:atan papahowih ila.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: rima’ ray kakiSka:atan, yako mangowip maraS ka kabang.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: yako kano’ ma’ ’okay ’araS.
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn't bring anything with me.

S.FORM: ray ’am kiSka:at, yako ki kapa’onhaelan ma’onhael komita’ ka kina:at.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: ’am ’a’inola’, kapa’onhaelan paSibae:aeh ’iyakin ka kaka:at ki tati:iS.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: kamatortoroe’ manabih ’iyakin komoSa’, “mowa:i’ nahan ’inremreme’ ’in’itol, ’izi’ papahowih ila!”
S.TRANSL: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」
The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""

S.FORM: ma’an kapa’onhaelan Sin ta:in, siya ma’ ’anka SaySiyat a korkoring.
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫ta:in，他也是賽夏族的小孩。
My good friend’s name is ta:in, and he is also an SaySiyat child.

S.FORM: yami ray Sawi’ hito’ ’ima kiSka:at.
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在獅潭部落讀書。
We study together in the Sawi’ tribe.

S.FORM: yami rengreng ma’onhael bazae’ noka tatini’ Sipayaka:i’ ka kinbazae’an, yami ra:am a tomal malnoSaySiyat.
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說賽夏語。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the SaySiyat proficiently.

S.FORM: yako ’ibabaw ma’ kerpe:, ta:in ’irira:i’an ma’ bali’.
S.TRANSL: 我很高也很胖，ta:in很矮也很瘦。
I am tall and overweight, while ta:in is short and thin.

S.FORM: ta:in wa’isan, saeboeh ma’ minowa’ hi siya.
S.TRANSL: ta:in很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。
ta:in is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: kaysa’an ray kakiSka:atan ’am homayaw ka basang, ray kakiSka:atan ’akoey ka pinatawaw ka’a’inola’en.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: hayza’ rara:hoeh ka Sina:iS, tomako: ka mali’, ’ae’ae:aew, homlal ki mae’nae’ ka boehoe:.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: yako ’a’inola’ ’ae’ae:aew.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: yako mam ’ae’ae:aew, yako ngizo’ ila, poe’oe’ ma’an ramoramo’an ila.
S.TRANSL: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: ’ana nakhini ya:o ma’ min’itol naehan, ’okay patae’aes ’am ’ae’ae:aew.
S.TRANSL: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: yako talsekel ila, saeboeh mae’iyaeh ma’ kin Siyae’.
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: ’ana ’okay mari’ ka minay ’aehae’ Sinepe:, yako ma’ kin Siyae’, yako hayza’ paksizaeh ’am ’a’inola.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: kahiya’ yako ki yaba rima’ payrarongaw hi mama’ ma’an.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: ni mama’ ’ae’ay panpangihin ila.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: siya mayaka:i’ ’iniya’om, ray taew’an sinakeban maehtang ila.
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: siya ’am tal’izaeh ka sinakeban, ’inray sinakeban Saehae’ ila.
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: yaba’ maraS ka katin ’ayam ki pinlong ’ini mama’.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: yako ki mama’ ray pino’azis ’a’iyalatar, siya paSekla’ ’akoey ka kinbazae’an.
S.TRANSL: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: yako ’am rasiwazay ila, mama’ romokor ’iyakin komoSa’ So’o ’ibabaw ila, ma’ tomal a tomal ila.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: yako Sa:, “So: mama’ ’ae’ay, kayzaeh ila ’isa:a’ wa:i’ ila panpanra:an kanniya’om ray taew’an.”
S.TRANSL: come to our house next time and visit us.""
I said, When your foot gets better

S.FORM: ray roSa’ siyan Sam’iyaeh o roSa’ tinal’oemaeh, to’oya’ ’a’iyalahoe: noka SaSinSinrahoe’ pinaSkira:a’ ka raro:o’ kayzaeh ka:aten nanaw ’anoka SaySiyat a raro:o’.
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: yako somingozaw ’ima honaehnge: ila kamarima’ homa:ih ka to’oya’ ray pinaSkira:a’ ka raro:o’ “patnonak noka SaySiyat a raro:o’” Say hito’ ’al’alak hi taro’.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年taro’。
I interviewed taro’, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: yako ki siya hayza’ ka pinapoe’oe’ ray hini ’aehae’ kaSangayan ’am rima’ kansiya ray taew’an somingozaw hi siya.
S.TRANSL: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: ray ’am somingozaw, siya pakSekla’ ila ’iyakin nisiya raro:o’ ’inay’ino’, ma’ pakSekla’ lasiya ’aehae’ taew’an mae’iyaeh ki ’insiya’a hito’.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: yako somingozaw hi siya ’ampowa’ somapih ka raro:o’, ’ima tatini’ pinaSkira:a’ ’aewhay ay?
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: siya tiSkobae:oeh ’iyakin komSa’, tani to’oya’ kina:at ’am ’okay Sekla’ i’ Sapang raro:o’ nisiya, ma’ hayza’ mae’iyaeh Somin hi siya “ta-Siyan-Sen” ’isa:a ma’ ’akoey ’ima pakaysawa’en ka howaw.
S.TRANSL: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Da Xian Sheng

S.FORM: taro’ Sa, “tani noka SinSinrahoe’ kina:at ka raro:o’ Sapang ’inmita’a raro:o’. ma’an raro:o’ mina ’iwan niya’om Sinrahoe’, niya’om ’aehae’ taew’an, niya’om pinaSkira:a’ pakSiwa’ haeba:an SinSinrahoe’ nonak tomihoroe: ka ’in nonak a raro:o’.”
S.TRANSL: our family
taro’ said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

S.FORM: kahiya’ yako tani hi koko’ rima’ ray ka titibae:iwan, titibae:iw ka tatimae’, koko’ maraS ’akoey nisiya nonak pinamowa’ ka por’oe’, ma’ paskayzaeh ’anoka SinSinrahoe’ a kasi’aelen no saeboeh.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: lasiya saeboeh minowa’ ni koko’ ka tinitibae:iw, baehko’ ki ’anhi’ haeba:an mae’iyaeh bae:iw, haeba:an mae’iyaeh mowa:i’ Santalam nisiya ka tinalek.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，擬德氏雙蓋蕨(菜)和竹筍很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: nisiya tinalek ka baehko’ ki ho’ol kayzaeh a tomal si’aelen, hayza’ naehan noka ma’aew rinenge: waliSan ’ayam, haeba:an mae’iyaeh minowa’, haeba:an mae’iyaeh mowa:i’ kanniya’om ray ka titibae:iwan mayna:a’.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的馬告滷肉，很多人喜歡，大家都來我們攤位排隊。
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: koko’ mam tomalek, yako ray langi: mam kamae:oeh ka mae’iyaeh, yako ray kabih ’omo’oe: Sa, “por’oe’ nonak pinamowa’ o, ’inokay po’iyo’i o, ’am’amoeh wa’ila’ bae:iw o!”
S.TRANSL: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
